value:
Professor... I humbly ask for your
guidance as I make my way in this
new world. I still have much to learn.

For better or worse, whatever her
path, Edelgard has possessed an
unstoppable will since childhood.

Askr's royalty sets a fine example.
I hope someday to be half as loved
by my people as they are by theirs.

The sins I bear will follow me forever.
I can only continue to atone and put
all I have toward defending my allies.

The greatest monument to honor
those who have lost their lives
is a world free of oppression.

I am Dimitri, King of Faerghus. I bring
wishes of good luck in battle
from $Nf.

From here forward, I will walk a
righteous path. Upon my lance,
I swear it.

Saving lives is the only moral purpose
to which I can put my strength.

I must become stronger than this
if I wish to achieve my goals...

I will use this power for the sake of
my people. You have my gratitude.

I am Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd, ruler
of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus.
I wield this lance for my people.

I once lost myself in a storm of
vengeance. That storm claimed
many lives.$k$pBut the voices of my friends, and the
people, whom my father left in my
care, brought me back from the brink.$k$pThe man who stands before you,
thanks to them, is a man who has
finally found his path.$k$pFor the sake of Faerghus, and for all
FÃ³dlan, I swear that I will never lose
my way again.$k$pPlease, $Nu, hold
me to my vow. Help me be
a righteous king.
(exertion)
I'll destroy you!
(exertion)
I'm not finished yet...
Out of the way!
I will protect my people!
This battle is over!
By my father's lance!
So this is my...punishment...
Hmph...
Seeing myself in the formal attire of the King of Faerghus will take some getting used to.
My position seldom leaves me time for frivolous conversation.
My road to redemption is long, but I hope to be something like my father by the end of it.
However ambitious the goal may be, a world free from oppression is worth fighting for.
The people put their faith in me. I must not disappoint them.
Though some sins cannot be forgiven effort to redeem oneself is never wasted.
Allow me to shoulder some of your burden. It would be my honor.
Leave it to me.
Don't be careless.
We will not falter.
